description._content: Get a list of the members of a group.  The call must be signed on behalf of a Flickr member, and the ability to see the group membership will be determined by the Flickr member's group privileges.

response._content:
<members page="1" pages="1" perpage="100" total="33">
<member nsid="123456@N01" username="foo" iconserver="1" iconfarm="1" membertype="2"/>
<member nsid="118210@N07" username="kewlchops666" iconserver="0" iconfarm="0" membertype="4"/>
<member nsid="119377@N07" username="Alpha Shanan" iconserver="0" iconfarm="0" membertype="2"/>
<member nsid="67783977@N00" username="fakedunstanp1" iconserver="1003" iconfarm="2" membertype="3"/>
...
</members>

argument.name: api_key
argument._content: Your API application key. See here for more details.

argument.name: group_id
argument._content: Return a list of members for this group.  The group must be viewable by the Flickr member on whose behalf the API call is made.

argument.name: membertypes
argument._content:
Comma separated list of member types
  • 2: member
  • 3: moderator
  • 4: admin
By default returns all types. (Returning super rare member type "1: narwhal" isn't supported by this API method)

argument.name: per_page
argument._content: Number of members to return per page. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 100. The maximum allowed value is 500.

argument.name: page
argument._content: The page of results to return. If this argument is omitted, it defaults to 1.

error._content: SSL is required to access the Flickr API.
The call required signing but no signature was sent.
The login details or auth token passed were invalid.

error.message: User not logged in / Insufficient permissions
error._content: The method requires user authentication but the user was not logged in, or the authenticated method call did not have the required permissions.
The API key passed was not valid or has expired.
The requested service is temporarily unavailable.
The requested operation failed due to a temporary issue.
The requested response format was not found.
The requested method was not found.
The SOAP envelope send in the request could not be parsed.
The XML-RPC request document could not be parsed.
One or more arguments contained a URL that has been used for abuse on Flickr.
